body_html:
Variables aren't created until after you call lstm_cell at least once. This is because it doesn't know the input shape yet, so it can't create the variables, which are shaped [*input_depth*, num_units].
…

Variables aren't created until after you call lstm_cell at least once.
This is because it doesn't know the input shape yet, so it can't create the
variables, which are shaped [*input_depth*, num_units].

body:
Variables aren't created until after you call lstm_cell at least once.
This is because it doesn't know the input shape yet, so it can't create the
variables, which are shaped [*input_depth*, num_units].

On Fri, Mar 16, 2018 at 10:55 AM, dmoham1476 <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> For me, even this is returning an empty list. I have tf 1.5
>
> lstm_cell = rnn.BasicLSTMCell(num_hidden, forget_bias=1.0)
>
> print("LSTM vars!", lstm_cell.variables)
>
